title: How to Read Allergy Skin Test Results

steps.title: Make an appointment with your doctor.
steps.content: Make an appointment with your doctor. [1] X Expert Source Farah Khan, MD Board Certified Allergist & Immunologist Expert Interview. 5 January 2022. If you develop a rash, hives, or skin irritation that you can not determine the cause of, make an appointment with your doctor for an allergy skin test. You may also make an appointment for a skin test if you develop health issues and are not sure what is causing it. Your doctor can then recommend a skin test to help you determine what is causing your health problems.

steps.title: Allow your doctor to clean your forearm with alcohol.
steps.content: Allow your doctor to clean your forearm with alcohol. Before your doctor, or nurse, administers the test, they will use a medical pad dipped in alcohol to clean a large area on your forearm. This will ensure the area is sterile for the test. [2] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Children usually get the test done on their upper back. If possible, discontinue any oral or nasal antihistamine medications for at least 72 hours prior to the test, otherwise these medications can impede skin testing results and cause false negative results. [3] X Expert Source Farah Khan, MD Board Certified Allergist & Immunologist Expert Interview. 5 January 2022.

steps.title: Get a skin prick test done for 10-40 substances.
steps.content: Get a skin prick test done for 10-40 substances. Your doctor will draw small marks on your skin and put a small drop of the allergen extract on each mark with a lancet. [4] X Expert Source Farah Khan, MD Board Certified Allergist & Immunologist Expert Interview. 5 January 2022. Depending on your medical history, the doctor may test you for at least 10 allergens and up to 40, ranging from mold, pollen, pet dander, dust mites, and certain foods. [5] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source The test will not be painful, as the lancets will just barely pierce your skin. There should be no blood and you should feel a mild discomfort at most.

steps.title: Let your doctor apply a histamine or saline solution as a control for the test.
steps.content: Let your doctor apply a histamine or saline solution as a control for the test. Once your doctor applies the skin prick test, they will scratch a histamine over the skin pricks to check that your skin responds properly to the test. [6] X Research source They will also apply a glycerin or saline solution to determine if you have sensitive skin. Your doctor will then keep your sensitive skin in mind when they review the results of the test.

steps.title: Get a skin injection done to test for an allergy to penicillin or venom.
steps.content: Get a skin injection done to test for an allergy to penicillin or venom. If your doctor is concerned that you might be allergic to penicillin or venom, they may administer an allergy test where a small amount of the allergen is injected into the skin on your arm. [7] X Research source The skin injection will not be very deep so it should not be painful.

steps.title: Have a patch test done to test for an allergy to a particular substance.
steps.content: Have a patch test done to test for an allergy to a particular substance. A patch test can help your doctor determine if you have any allergies that may not show up right away, or are delayed. Your doctor will prepare a patch that contains an allergen and then place it on your skin. They can test you for 20-30 allergens at a time, such as fragrances, hair dyes, latex, preservatives, and medications. [8] X Trustworthy Source HealthyChildren.org Health information from the American Academy of Pediatrics. Go to source You will need to wear the patch for 48 hours and avoid bathing or doing strenuous activity that could cause you to sweat.

steps.title: Check for wheals and flares 15-20 minutes after you get the allergy skin test.
steps.content: Check for wheals and flares 15-20 minutes after you get the allergy skin test. [9] X Expert Source Farah Khan, MD Board Certified Allergist & Immunologist Expert Interview. 5 January 2022. Your skin should react within 15-20 minutes of your doctor administering a skin prick or allergy injection test. Your doctor will have you wait in their office so they can review the results of the test. [10] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Allergy skin tests are more accurate when they are left on for at least 15 minutes and no longer than 40 minutes. If you received a patch test, it may take at least 48 hours for any allergic reactions to appear. You may need to return to your doctorâ€™s office to get the results of the test.

steps.title: Look for wheals that are 3 millimetres (0.12 in) in diameter or bigger.
steps.content: Look for wheals that are 3 millimetres (0.12 in) in diameter or bigger. Wheals will appear as raised bumps that are swollen or red, much like mosquito bites. [11] X Expert Source Farah Khan, MD Board Certified Allergist & Immunologist Expert Interview. 5 January 2022. They may itch or feel irritated. If you have wheals on any areas where an allergen was placed on your skin, you likely had an allergic reaction to the substance. [12] X Trustworthy Source HealthyChildren.org Health information from the American Academy of Pediatrics. Go to source If you are allergic to multiple substances, you may have multiple wheals. Wheals that are smaller than 3 millimetres (0.12 in) in diameter may not be a sign of an allergic reaction.

steps.title: Check for flares that are bright red.
steps.content: Check for flares that are bright red. Flares are patches of redness that appear due to an allergic reaction. [13] X Expert Source Farah Khan, MD Board Certified Allergist & Immunologist Expert Interview. 5 January 2022. You may notice flares in the areas where the allergy skin test was administered. If you have flares and wheals in the same area, this usually means you are allergic to the substance. [14] X Trustworthy Source American College of Allergy, Asthma, and Immunology National professional organization of allergists, asthma specialists and immunologists that focuses on supporting and publishing research Go to source The presence of flares and no wheals may mean your skin is irritated by the substance, but you are not allergic to it.

steps.title: Allow your doctor to interpret the results of the test.
steps.content: Allow your doctor to interpret the results of the test. Your doctor will examine your skin for wheals and flare to determine which substances you are allergic to. [15] X Expert Source Farah Khan, MD Board Certified Allergist & Immunologist Expert Interview. 5 January 2022. They will have the training necessary to determine when your skin is irritated and when you are having an allergic reaction due to the substance. [16] X Trustworthy Source American College of Allergy, Asthma, and Immunology National professional organization of allergists, asthma specialists and immunologists that focuses on supporting and publishing research Go to source If you have very large wheals due to an allergen, you may have a high level of sensitivity to a substance or food. Your doctor will let you know which substances you tested positive for in terms of an allergy.

steps.title: Get a second test done if you want to be sure of your allergies.
steps.content: Get a second test done if you want to be sure of your allergies. It is possible for an allergy test to be inaccurate the first time around, causing a false positive or a false negative. If you want to be sure you are allergic to certain substances, you may ask your doctor to administer another round of skin tests. [17] X Trustworthy Source American College of Allergy, Asthma, and Immunology National professional organization of allergists, asthma specialists and immunologists that focuses on supporting and publishing research Go to source Usually if you test positive for an allergy to a substance more than once, it means you are allergic to it.

steps.title: Adjust your diet or lifestyle to avoid contact with allergens.
steps.content: Adjust your diet or lifestyle to avoid contact with allergens. Once you determine what substances you are allergic to, you should do your best to avoid interacting with them. This may mean cutting certain foods out of your diet or switching your skin care products so you do not expose your skin to allergens. Your doctor should tell you how severe your allergies are to certain substances so you do not put your health at risk. [18] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source For example, if you have a mild allergy to cats, your doctor may recommend you stay away from cats and take allergy medication before you interact with cats. Or if you have a severe allergy to peanuts, your doctor may suggest you avoid eating peanuts and confirm foods do not have peanuts before you eat them. For some allergens, you may have a very minor reaction, such as a rash or skin irritation. But if you continue to expose yourself to the allergen, your reactions may get worse over time. Try to avoid being around any allergens so you stay healthy.
